intro: Tetracera rigida, commonly known as the rigid tetracera, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments. Tetracera rigida is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some cultures.
